results.name: Number of solutions to +-p(1)+-p(2)+-...+-p(2n) = 3 where p(i) is the i-th prime.
comment: +-p(1)+-p(2)+-...+-p(2n+1) = 3 does not have solutions, since the left hand side is even. [Corrected and edited by _M. F. Hasler_, Aug 09 2015]
link: Alois P. Heinz and Ray Chandler, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1000 (first 120 terms from Alois P. Heinz)
maple: A113042:=proc(n) local i,j,p,t; t:= NULL; for j from 2 to 2*n by 2 do p:=1; for i to j do p:=p*(x^(-ithprime(i))+x^(ithprime(i))); od; t:=t,coeff(p,x,3); od; t; end;
mathematica: sp[n_] := sp[n] = If[n == 0, 0, Prime[n] + sp[n-1]]; b[n_, i_] := b[n, i] = If[n>sp[i], 0, If[i == 0, 1, b[n + Prime[i], i-1] + b[Abs[n - Prime[i]], i-1]]]; a[n_] := b[3, 2*n]; Table[a[n], {n, 1, 30}] (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Jan 31 2017, after _Alois P. Heinz_ *)
